1.title: Mr. Bad's Bad Parade Day
1.plot: When the Mayor announces preparations for the Founder's Day Parade, the Superchums set about building their parade float. Buzz Girl and Changerella lower their bust of Lord Super Crumpton, but Brass Butt is scared and destroys it. Eric explains it is not a giant head, and attempts to lower another bust which Brass Butt destroys again. When they complete the float, Captain Scrumptious and Slime Boy sabotage the engine. In the Janitorium, Mr. Bad unveils his new evil device: a toxic sneeze dispenser shaped in a porcelain nose. All he needs is something to which he can ...

2.title: The Good Brother of Mr. Bad
2.plot: The Superchums rehearse their welcome for the arrival of the superhero Mr. Good. Meanwhile in the Janitorium, Mr. Bad reveals that Mr. Good is his twin and resolves to avoid his visit by pushing Crumptonville into the sea. Mr. Good arrives and avoids the town being damaged by digging a large hole down which Mr. Bad plummets. The Superchums volunteer to teach Mr. Bad to be good. After some lessons, Mr. Bad tries to think of a way to pretend to create something good which is secretly something bad. He takes a giant wooden crate to Crumptonville, and once the Mr. Good ...

3.title: Stop Kidding Around
3.plot: At school the Roving Eye proudly unveils a new building, the Hero Hut, which is inadvertently destroyed by Brass Butt. The Superchums are ordered to build a replacement in Eric's backyard. In the Janitorium, Mr. Bad unveils his latest plan: to use a giant magnet to pull the Moon closer to Earth, sending the ocean's tides into chaos and sinking Crumptonville under the Sea. On seeing the new Hero Hut, he decides to trick the Superchums into constructing a building for his 'Moon Magnet', and orders Appliance to use the 'Bratilizer' ray to turn him into a boy. Disguised ...

4.title: Mr. Bad Vibrations
4.plot: At home, Eric is disturbed at night and finds Brass Butt in his garden digging for treasure. Brass Butt's shovel hits an earthquake fault line. In the Janitorium, Mr. Bad unveils his Hammer-bot, but the earthquake causes the robot to hammer Mr. Bad. Eric stops the crack in the ground using a band-aid and orders the Superchums to guard the fault line. Mr. Bad discovers the crack in Eric's garden and decides to use the Hammerbot to pound it and unleash the largest earthquake the world has ever seen. When this does not work, Mr. Bad plans to turn on all the blenders in ...

5.title: Throgg No Happy
5.plot: Throgg, a caveman in pre-historic times, is frozen in a snow avalanche. In Crumptonville today, Eric and the Superchums are on a school field trip to a snowy mountain and Brass Butt thaws Thorgg by licking him like a popsicle. They present him to the Mayor who instantly gives him a job in his office. Thorgg does not enjoy modern life in the office, and resigns when he is defeated by the photocopier. He returns to his tree and is enraged when it is cut down by Brass Butt. Thog declares caveman war on technology, and Brass Butt tries to cheer him up by cutting off all ...

6.title: When TV Scientists Attack
6.plot: At school the Roving Eye proudly unveils a new building, the Hero Hut, which is inadvertently destroyed by Brass Butt. The Superchums are ordered to build a replacement in Eric's backyard. In the Janitorium, Mr. Bad unveils his latest plan: to use a giant magnet to pull the Moon closer to Earth, sending the ocean's tides into chaos and sinking Crumptonville under the Sea. On seeing the new Hero Hut, he decides to trick the Superchums into constructing a building for his 'Moon Magnet', and orders Appliance to use the 'Bratilizer' ray to turn him into a boy. Disguised ...

7.title: Smartest Butt in the World
7.plot: The Superchums conduct basic intelligence tests on Brass Butt in a maze. Mr. Bad watches on, and assumes they have the smartest rat in the world. Brass Butt and Eric wear foil on their heads on a winner's podium as Mr. Bad deploys his Brain Shrinking Ray. The ray makes everyone in Crumptonville stupid apart from Eric and Brass Butt. Passing aliens are attracted by a blinking street lamp, but when they land the Superchums offend them. They threaten to destroy the town and challenge Brass Butt to complete a maze against them. When Brass Butt charges through the maze ...

8.title: Night of the Vampire Sheep
8.plot: It's Halloween, but the Superchums are kept behind in detention when they accidentally destroy the school's trophy cabinet. They must write an essay using books from the forbidden section of doom in the library. Brass Butt reads aloud a curse from a book causing Ramsferatu, a Vampire Sheep, to come to life. He visits the Superchums, but is scared off by Eric's woollen sweater. At the annual pumpkin carving, Brass Butt is slowly turning into a sheep and Ramsferatu arrives to 'butt' the townsfolk. Eric deduces the book is the cause so he takes the Superchums back to the...

9.title: Mr. Bad Shaves the World
9.plot: The Superchums manage to lose the bulldozer they are supposed to be guarding, and so are given an F grade by the Roving Eye. Mr. Bad has stolen the bulldozer to push Crumptonville off the edge of the world, but is disappointed to learn the Earth is not flat. Mr. Bad vows to shave the Earth into a square in order to push Crumptonville off the edge, and is missing enough metal the size of Brass Butt's butt to build a shaver. Brass Butt awakens to find his metal butt has been stolen, thus losing his superhero power. Changerella gnaws him a wooden butt replacement. Back ...

10.title: Elephantastique
10.plot: The Superchums are guarding Crumptonville Zoo from evil but Brass Butt mistakenly tosses an elephant into the air. Mr. Bad decides to create an army of flying elephants, and dresses as a giant peanut to lure them. When this plan fails he wears an elephant disguise, but Brass Butt hurls him into the elephant habitat. Eventually Mr. Bad uses a giant jar of peanut butter to persuade the elephants to follow him. The Superchums discover the missing elephants and try to cover for them at the show they are supposed to perform. Mr. Bad rides the elephants to destroy ...

11.title: Weather or Not
11.plot: Mr. Bad presents his new Weather Control Machine to Appliance but finds it only causes a very small effect. At School the Mayor's Mother arrives in the middle of his speech and orders him to give her a tour to prove that the town is nice. Mr. Bad sees this as an opportunity to terrorise Crumptonville and takes his weather machine to the TV station to broadcast its effects over a larger area. The Superchums offer to show the Mayor's Mother around the city and take her to the lake which is evaporated by Mr. Bad's intense sunshine. Eric suggests a picnic instead and Mr. ...

12.title: Eat Your Veggies Before They Eat You
12.plot: Mr. Bad watches the Superchums eating vegetables in the school cafeteria and decides to use a laser carrot ray to remove their vitamins in order to defeat them. The Roving Eye employs the Superchums as cafeteria workers, and Mr. Bad asks Brass Butt to use his laser on the school's vegetables. The food comes to life and runs amok, turning on Mr. Bad and capturing the Superchums. The evil vegetables storm Crumptonville as Eric & Co. gather snails from the town. The veggies use cows suspended from helium balloons and threaten to cover the city in fertilizer, but one cow ...

13.title: One Bad Turn
13.plot: Roving Eye announces a superhero fitness test during which the Superchums create a great mess in Crumptonville. Amongst the clutter Mr. Bad and Appliance find the plans of a giant screw holding the city to Mount Crumptonville. They decide to unscrew it and let Crumptonville fall into the sea, but the bolt creates a very loud rusty squeak. Mr. Bad visits the Mayor disguised as a cowboy and lies that there is a large diamond inside Mt. Crumptonville. The Mayor hands him some dynamite to retrieve the diamond, and orders the city to wear earmuffs to protect their ears ...

1.title: Stop Clowning Around
1.plot: Eric and the Superchums have to tackle Tickles the Evil Clown. He's tired of everyone laughing at him and vows to destroy Crumptonville with a giant pie.

2.title: Partly Cloudy with a Slight Chance of Donkey
2.plot: It's "Bring Your Pet To School Day", but disaster for the Superchums when Brass Butt's donkey dances into a tornado. Can Eric divert the whirlwind and save Crumptonville?

3.title: Hard as Snails
3.plot: An ancient tribe of giant snail people are accidentally awakened by the Superchums. They threaten to destroy the world... and Eric's Dad's prize pumpkin.

4.title: Hold the Pickle
4.plot: When Eric causes a superhero lesson to go wrong, the Superchums have to get rid of a mountain of pickles.

5.title: The Gouda, the Brie, and the Ugly
5.plot: Eric and the Superchums do battle with Mr. Bad's new evil robot: The deadly Cheesinator.

6.title: The Ice Cream Man Cometh
6.plot: Eric and the Superchums discover all the ice-cream in Crumptonville has been replaced by disgusting flavours.

7.title: Beware of Baby Brother!
7.plot: When Crumptonville's big brothers are all kidnapped, Eric vows the Superchums will rescue them. But Brass Butt is not too keen.

8.title: Big King Monkey Gorilla
8.plot: Eric's plan to rescue a visiting space ape goes wrong and Big King Monkey Gorilla vows to destroy the world.

9.title: A Stitch in Crime
9.plot: Eric's class has a new teacher, but no one believes Buzz Girl's warning that it's her evil Granny, "The Knitter".

10.title: Full of Hot Air
10.plot: Eric and the Superchums vow to stop Tickles the evil clown's plan to destroy all parties forever.

11.title: It's Curtains for Crumptonville
11.plot: Eric and the Superchums discover Mr. Bad's latest plan when he steals all their curtains.

12.title: It's a Bird! It's a Plane! It's Supermannequin!
12.plot: Crumptonville falls into peril when Eric and the Superchums accidentally bring the town's mannequins to life.

13.title: Very Mad Cows
13.plot: Eric and the Superchums have to save Crumptonville from a herd of intelligent cows.

14.title: Mr. Bad Waits for No Man
14.plot: Eric and the Superchums have to save Crumptonville when Mr. Bad tears a hole in time.

15.title: Find Fong
15.plot: The Superchums must make a special shampoo to help Brass Butt beat Granny's Girl at Super Hero School Sports Day.

16.title: Evil Barks and Wets the Carpet
16.plot: Eric and the Superchums accidentally annoy their neighbour, Mr. Tabby.

17.title: It Rhymes with Coo!
17.plot: Eric has to save Crumptonville from Dr. Coo and his flock of evil pigeons.

18.title: Earth Ball, Corner Pocket
18.plot: Eric has to stop Mr. Bad's enormous pool cue potting the Earth into the Sun.

19.title: Dam Beavers
19.plot: Eric and the Superchums have to save Crumptonville from Mr. Bad's army of trained beavers.

20.title: Would Like to Eat
20.plot: Eric and the Superchums cause an invasion of very hungry aliens. Meanwhile Mr. Bad is trying to find romance.

21.title: Send in the Clowns
21.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to stop Tickles entering the fashion business when his designs threaten to turn the people of Crumptonville into clowns.

22.title: League of Evil Teachers
22.plot: Eric and the Superchums have to fail their lessons when a group of evil teachers take over their school.

23.title: The Incredible Shrinking Mr. Bad
23.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to stop Mr. Bad's robot assistant destroying Crumptonville.

24.title: The Pansy
24.plot: It's Valentines Day and Eric has to battle Crumptonville's evil florist, The Pansy.

25.title: Mr. Badsketball
25.plot: Eric and the Superchums challenge Mr. Bad to a game of basketball.

26.title: Day of the Wrecking Ball
26.plot: When Eric and the Superchums fail a school test, Brass Butt takes a job as Mr. Bad's assistant.

1.title: Winning Isn't Everything, There's Also Losing!
1.plot: Eric volunteers the Superchums to represent Crumptonville at the annual Quiztastic Quiz-a-thon.

2.title: Web of Intrigue (and Ropes and Glue)
2.plot: Eric and the Superchums battle the Spider Mayor who threatens to eat everyone in Crumptonville.

3.title: Butter Me Up!
3.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to stop Mr. Bad using the town's butter to slide Crumptonville into the ocean.

4.title: Eight Arms to Pound You
4.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to capture an octopus monster which threatens to destroy Crumptonville.

5.title: Mr. Bad's Bad Suit
5.plot: Eric and the Superchums guard the "World's Largest Eclair" from the clutches of Mr. Bad and "The Really Big Mechanical Suit".

6.title: Flushed with Anger
6.plot: Eric and the Superchums tackle Sewer Man and his plan to use Crumptonville's toilets for evil.

7.title: Freeze!
7.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to stop Mr. Bad's plot to crush Crumptonville under an avalanche of giant ice cubes.

8.title: Deck the Malls with Dolls of Shoppy
8.plot: When Eric and the Superchums go shopping for presents they encounter "Shoppy", the angry "Nondescript Holiday Season Elf".

9.title: The Powers That Be... Gone!
9.plot: When Eric and the Superchums destroy Mr. Wilson's garden, he takes revenge by removing everyone's super powers.

10.title: Music Man-iac!
10.plot: Eric and the Superchums try to win the school's talent show.

11.title: Bring Me Sunshine
11.plot: Eric and the Superchums risk losing a bobsled competition when Mr. Bad raises Crumptonville on two extremely long car jacks.

12.title: The Very Most Simple Plan of Mr. Bad Yet
12.plot: Eric and the Superchums try out their new secret identities while Mr. Bad tries stealing all the flowers in Crumptonville.

13.title: The Thing with No Brain
13.plot: Double trouble for Eric and the Superchums when Mr. Bad swaps brains with a large powerful gorilla.

imdb.plot outline: Eric Normal is a teenage superhero...with no superpowers at all. He, with his super-powered friends Brass Butt, Changerella and Buzz Girl enroll in an academy for budding heroes and go on crazy adventures, while learning what it means to be a true hero.
imdb.title: SuperNormal
plot: Eric Normal is a teenage superhero...with no superpowers at all. He, with his super-powered friends Brass Butt, Changerella and Buzz Girl enroll in an academy for budding heroes and go on crazy adventures, while learning what it means to be a true hero.
